question: Who are Francophones?
possible_answers: A. People speaking French as a first language
B. People who come from France
C. People who are learning French
D. People speaking French as a secondary language
answer: A. People speaking French as a first language
explanatory_sentence: Today, there are 18 million Anglophones—people who speak English as a first language—and seven million Francophones—people who speak French as their first language.
